text:
Hi everyone,
I'm looking to confirm if it's possible to achieve this using custom-coded workflow actions in HubSpot:
Enroll my Custom Object into a workflow where a custom-coded action:
    ◦ Reads all associated contacts with the label "Contact registered for Event" and updates the label to "Contact not attended."
    ◦ Then checks for contacts that have both the labels "Contact registered for Event" _and_ "Contact attended" and removes only the "Contact registered for Event" label.
The goal is to implement a "check-in complete" property that triggers the Event object and performs the actions described above.

Is this achievable with custom-coded actions?

Hi <@U04C0NVUQ7Q> :wave:
Yes, it should be possible to achieve that via custom code workflow actions. However, this would depend on the volume of data you're working with as custom code workflow actions currently have a max execution time limit of 20 seconds. Also, records of which object-type will be enrolled in the workflow? You mention the "Event" object, but I don't see this as a standard option when creating a HubSpot Workflow, but maybe you're working with a custom object?
